subject: Philosophy
title: Straw Man
description: Learn Straw Man in one minute.

hook.text: She says we should spend more on education. He responds: 'So you want to bankrupt the country?' That's a straw man.

buildup.text: A straw man distorts someone's argument into an easier target, then attacks the distortion.

discovery.text: The original argument is replaced with a weaker version that's simpler to defeat.

twist.text: It works because audiences often don't notice the switch. The distorted version sounds close enough.

climax.text: To avoid straw men, restate your opponent's argument in their own terms before you respond.

punchline.text: Fight the real argument, not the one you invented.

quiz.question: What is a straw man fallacy?
options: Distorting someone's argument to make it easier to attack
Using a metaphor in an argument
Building a weak argument on purpose
